channel.title: [PI]"Forums" Command?[PI]
channel.description: I Need A Command ":: Forums" On A PI Source... How Do I Do This? Or You Can Fix My Client.. When In Client And I Go To File> Forums It Don't Load Up.. I Would Perfur The Client To Be Fixed And I Also Want A Command So Yea :) Thanks Guys!

item.title: [PI]"Forums" Command?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @moerin moerin
item.description:
@moerin wrote:

[quote=“Ashton51, post:11, topic:370219”][quote author=Perses Pkers link=topic=466336.msg3410834#msg3410834 date=1290670185]

Lmfao; I failed.

I missed an obvious bracket.

Here you go;

if(inputString.equals("forums")) {
    launchURL("http://www.forums.com");
}

Or;

if(inputString.equals("forums")) {
    openURL("http://www.forums.com");
}

Sorry about that.
[/quote]Still Didn’t Work Sorry

If your on the pi client then this does work

if(playerCommand.startsWith("forums")) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("www.forums.com", 12000); }[/quote]
Works for me on my PI server. The only problem is only i can open it. Nobody else can.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]"Forums" Command?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

Perses Pkers:

Naa Man I Added That To My Commands.java Still Don’t Work… Now It Does Nothing.

your on a different client then

there are ways of making clickable links in your client, search for those and modify it a bit to make it pop up on command instead of when clicking on a link, i know theres plenty of tuts on how to do this on r-s

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]"Forums" Command?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=466336.msg3410434#msg3410434 date=1290640026]
Should have looked at my tutorial:

                        if(playerCommand.startsWith("forums")) {
c.getPA().sendFrame126("www.forums.com", 12000);
                        }

[/quote]He wants it to open up, not just tell the link.

@OP; fix the ActionEvents in the jFrame to fix the forum button on the client, and add this inputString in the client class.

if(inputString.equals("forums")) launchURL("http://www.forums.com"); }
Not sure if it’s launchURL, or openURL.

Try them both.
[/code][/quote]Man I Tryed Your Code Both Ways… I Still Got The 100 Errors?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]"Forums" Command?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=466336.msg3410556#msg3410556 date=1290649998]
But the ending part of it ‘12000’ would load the website; if it was ‘8144’ then it would make a pop-up saying the link.
[/quote]I don’t see how using frame(126) and appending it to a certain interface text-line would load a website through the client.[/quote]

Its only for the PI client

Read full topic
